title: Blended Learning Design for Medical Education: Applying Flipped Learning and the 4Es Learning Cycle

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental medical terminology and physiology knowledge, basic smartphone usage skills
context.additional_context: Blended learning course combining flipped learning with the 4Es learning cycle in smartphone-centric constrained environments. Enhances medical education efficiency through pre-learning and advanced activities using offline classes and webinars.

learning_goals: Students can analyze flipped mini-lectures provided via webinars with over 80% comprehension and summarize core concepts.

Students can complete medical case-solving projects collaboratively with peers in offline classes at over 90% proficiency following the 4Es learning cycle (Engagement, Exploration, Explanation, Extension).
Students can provide peer feedback at least three times on an asynchronous discussion platform using smartphones and achieve over 75% engagement reflecting critical thinking.

resources: Smartphone-Compatible Webinar Platform (Zoom, Google Meet, etc.)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
